reviews.review_msg: GREAT prof. Chill and approachable. Class was hard, but not too stressful. All homework questions were directly from lecture notes, which he didn't post online - i went to all lectures, they were always clear. Be prepared to take lots of notes and commit a LOT of time. Answers emails, is actually helpful and available in office hours.

The course was really great. It was hard, but we learned a lot! After this course I would like to do research in algorithms. Igor was very nice, always willing to help, and always responds to email and piazza.

This class was a total waste of time and money. Course covered too many separate topics and many parts were treated as "black box" parts in proofs. Homework took hours and taught us nothing. Igor did not seem interested in answering helping in understanding concepts. Any questions about homework or concepts he'd deflect to posted solutions.

Mixed feelings about Pearce. If you take a course that Pearce is teaching because he's genuinely interested in teaching (ex: 409, 320), he'll be interesting but if you take a course that he's being forced to teach by the faculty (MACM 101), he'll be pretty bad. 
For 409, interesting lectures, but disorganized.

This is for the first offering of the special topics class on Quantum Computing. Given the circumstances, I think he did OK. None of us had the necessary math background to understand much of QC, and this is the first offering. He did what he could to get us to understand QC concepts and his passion was apparent. Homework and exams were very easy.

Course: Intro to Quantum Computing Pearce bounces around lecture slides in a dizzying manner, while assailing the class with an absolute wall of information. There's no dedicated course website, yet tons of outside resources (multiple textbooks, papers, videos). It's the first iteration of the course and it definitely needs improved structure.

Admittedly, the course was probably too hard for me. The content relied on lots of pre-requisite math that I didn't have. I would say, however, that Mat did explain the material as clearly as possible so that my little reptile brain could understand some of it.

Also, Mat is definitely very knowledgable in his area of research.

She's enthusiastic and seems interested in the course material, but she isn't good at explaining the concepts of the course. The "textbook" used for the course is just notes by another professor, and her notes are just the textbook re-copied without any explanation. Better to just read the textbook. Would not recommend taking this course with her.

Disorganized, rushed lectures. Doesn't seem to have any hand in the creation or marking of homework (when I go to her office hours, it seems like she has never even seen the assignment before). Does not explain concepts well at all.
